"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e599836368720e78470100#post_53e599836368720e78470100
[bq="trashboat"]I felt that pacific rim wasn't that great.

It could have been better. (It did manage to capture the spirit of Tokusatsu really good, But I felt it didn't really capture the spirit of Super robot very well.)[/bq]
Considering that the last big western monster movie excluding cloverfield(I don't really count that as a monster movie cause it's like the director of the blair witch hunt sat down and watched Godzilla and thought they could do that easy) was Godzilla 1998 and how bad that was I think even you can be glad that the west is giving kaijus a second chance at mainstream.

Godzilla 2014 everyone was apprehensive about it cause everyone still remembers Godzilla 1998 and thought it was going to be Godzilla 1998 part 2 and chances are if it weren't for Pacific Rim chances are not as many people would have given Godzilla 2014 a chance.

Power rangers has probably damaged the Reputation of Tokusatsu more than anything else in the west.

Americans actually used to like Ultraman quite a bit back in the 60s and 70s, Now you get the "Is this power rangers?" Responses

In a derogatory sense.

topics.body: The reason why people refuse to listen to me when I make a point in a debate is because they know I'm right.
topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e5a0306368720b092a0100#post_53e5a0306368720b092a0100
There are serious Toku out there. (Like Kamen rider Faiz, Kamen rider Kuuga, Ultraseven, And Garo)

But for some reason, Us americans can't seem over the inherent Camp of Toku.

It's not like It can't be serious. Like I said, The aforementioned shows.) Everyone's just hung up ever "Muh realism"

Frankly, I don't get why, I love Karate bugmen kicking monsters in the face, I love Giant aliens beating the crap out of rubber suit monsters, I love Giant robots and Groups in Color coded suits.

Your shows don't need to be constant downers in order to be High class and thought provoking. (Look at Kamen rider Kuuga.)
